summary: This bill, the Young African Leaders Initiative Act of 2025, establishes a U.S. government program (YALI) to build the capacity of young leaders and entrepreneurs in sub-Saharan Africa. It aims to enhance leadership skills, encourage entrepreneurship, strengthen public administration, promote peace and security, and connect young African leaders. The bill mandates fellowships, reciprocal exchanges, regional leadership centers, and reports to Congress. It focuses on economic growth, transparency, and youth empowerment within the African continent, and includes a sunset clause. The program is to be overseen by the Secretary of State.
